channel.title: Pk area menu - 317 -
channel.description:
Is there a way to make it where when I type in the command ::pkmenu it pops up a menu that has cancel at the bottom to exit out of the window, and inside it there are like 5 boxes. Each one with a different name and when you click it, it teles you there. For example.. __________ [-Pk Areas-] [Mage Bank] [Drags ] [Ruins ] [_________]
Thats just a very bad concept, I know how to do coordinates but not with a menu and stuff. If anyone could help me it would be very much appreciated!

item.title: Pk area menu - 317 -
item.dc:creator: @99range_k0 99range k0
item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

[quote=“pl0x15, post:2, topic:340921”]Client.Java Then add this next to ::commands idk how to format this cuz idk ur base but change it.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pkmenu") && playerRights >= 0) { sendQuestinterface= sendQuest("Edgeville Pk!");6857 sendQuest("Mage Bank!");6857 sendQuest("Varrock Pk!");6857

i know its wrong. alot of it. but try to fix it up, im sorry =(

then go to clickingmost.java and make it so its clickable and triggertele to the cords. sorry my lil tut isnt good. i thot it off top of my head.[/quote]
I’m gonna test this out, but true its not the best, but it seems like this may work. Better than no answer. I’ll go test this out in a sec.

Thanks

item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

Is there a way to make it where when I type in the command ::pkmenu
it pops up a menu that has cancel at the bottom to exit out of the window, and inside it there are like 5 boxes. Each one with a different name and when you click it, it teles you there. For example…

[-Pk Areas-]
[Mage Bank]
[Drags ]

[_________]

Thats just a very bad concept, I know how to do coordinates but not with a menu and stuff.
